meanings.sent1: The outfit she wore to the party was quite inelegant.
meanings.sent2: The ballerina's movements were smooth and graceful, unlike the inelegant steps of the beginner.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at a fancy bow tie ended up looking rather inelegant.
meanings.sent4: The old, rusty car moved down the street in an inelegant manner, coughing and sputtering.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes were so inelegant that the painting appeared almost childlike.

meanings.definition: Clumsy or awkward in design or execution
meanings.sent1: The chair's uneven legs made it quite inelegant in the room.
meanings.sent2: The inelegant font choice made the poster difficult to read from a distance.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at juggling ended in an inelegant mess of dropped balls.
meanings.sent4: The inelegant dance routine left the audience cringing in their seats.
meanings.sent5: The inelegant solution to the problem only caused more confusion.

meanings.definition: Not characterized by elegance or sophistication
meanings.sent1: The restaurant's plastic utensils gave it an inelegant feel.
meanings.sent2: The inelegant speech lacked the eloquence expected from a public figure.
meanings.sent3: The cat's inelegant attempt to catch the mouse ended in a comical chase around the room.
meanings.sent4: The inelegant building stood out among the sleek, modern architecture of the city.
meanings.sent5: Her inelegant manners at the dinner table shocked the guests.
